title: [口徑一致] 中英用語對照表

replies.msg:
Since the huge leap of LIHKG started its grow to the world. What we should do is to keep our daily slangs & terms are unified even in English.

Any idea for this one?

E.G.
There are so many version in English referring to the word of 連登, just like LINDEN FORUM, LIHKG FORUM, LIN HONG KONG etc.

Sorry for poor English
Lihkg is always written as lihkg

Let’s join our discussion for ALL of terms & slangs we used on daily basis, not just 連登.

Likewise, 連登仔，高登 etc etc.

quote.msg: Lihkg is always written as lihkg

replies.msg: Yup, but there’s no one could able to get literally what is LIHKG.

quote.msg: Lihkg is always written as lihkg
Yup, but there’s no one could able to get literally what is LIHKG.

replies.msg:
Just a name
And language keeps on evolve
The more you use it, the more common the word is

Just like should we use “Protest” or “Demonstration” to refer our resistances?

Or how should be interpret 義士 手足 in English.

We do need to always keep in mind that, this sub is build for the world to know what is happening in Hong Kong, and we do need our 口徑 to be same as unified.
